Benjamin Netanyahu under close US watch
subhead: Trump officials are making repeated trips to Israel to safeguard the Gaza ceasefire, fearing the Israeli prime minister could derail it. Secretary of State Marco Rubio will visit Jerusalem on Thursday to maintain pressure.

2030 Winter Olympics: UN body set to examine potential 'environmental democracy' breaches
subhead: The Aarhus Convention Compliance Committee is set to hear from citizens and elected officials who have criticized the lack of public consultation over the Winter Olympics, which are being organized in the French Alps.

title: Cédric Jubillar trial: What led to the 30-year prison sentence for the murder of his wife
subhead: In a written ruling released on Thursday, the court fully adopted the 'body of evidence' presented by the prosecution, finding that Delphine Aussaguel's death was beyond doubt and that her husband was responsible.

title: Sarkozy imprisonment: Armed officers guarding the ex-president spark shock and outrage
subhead: On Wednesday, interior minister Laurent Nuñez defended the measure, citing Nicolas Sarkozy's 'status' and 'threats against him.' Prison guard unions decried it as 'security madness' and 'unprecedented humiliation.'

title: Deregulated Argentina rushes to buy from global e-commerce giants
subhead: Online orders from Shein, Temu and Amazon have soared in just a few months since the Milei government relaxed regulations and cut taxes. The clothing sector, in particular, now faces a serious threat.

From 'boomers' to 'Gen Z': Where do generational labels come from?
subhead: While young activists in several countries are rallying under the 'Gen Z' banner, the concept of generations remains contentious. Its origins lie more in journalism and marketing than in science.

title: 'Russian Secrets': How Russia built an Arctic spy network using European equipment
subhead: Hidden behind shell companies, Russia acquired advanced Western technologies to build a secret underwater network designed to protect its nuclear weapons. The incident raises questions about Europe's ability to prevent the export of sensitive technologies to Moscow.

title: A new Israeli-Palestinian restaurant promotes peace through food in Paris
subhead: Edgar Laloum and Radjaa Aboudagga have just opened Sababa in Paris, offering bicultural culinary specialties. The two partners hope that, through the joys of culinary arts, they can help foster understanding and peace between communities.
